product_overview: The Asma Ul Husna Learning Module is an interactive web application designed to help users learn, memorize, and understand the 99 Names of Allah. It provides a premium, engaging experience through flashcards, quizzes, and detailed browsing with audio pronunciations and linguistic insights.
core_goals: Facilitate memorization of the 99 Names of Allah using interactive tools like flashcards and quizzes.
Deepen user understanding through detailed categorizations, linguistic roots, and Quranic references.
Deliver a premium aesthetic and user experience with responsive design, dark theme, and elegant typography.
Ensure accessibility with audio playback and intuitive navigation.
Persist user progress and preferences via LocalStorage.
key_features: Browse Mode with interactive cards featuring collapsed and expanded views including audio playback, filtering, sorting, and real-time search.
Flashcard Mode with active recall, card flipping, and deck management prioritizing difficult names.
Quiz Mode with multiple-choice and fill-in-the-blank assessments, varied question types, and session progress tracking.
High-quality audio playback for correct pronunciation of each name.
Filtering by category (Jalal, Jamal, Kamal) and status (Favorites, Memorized).
Premium Dark Mode theme with golden accents and elegant Arabic calligraphy fonts paired with clean Swedish text.
LocalStorage-based state management for persisting favorites, memorized names, and progress.
user_flow_summary: User opens the app and lands on Browse Mode displaying a list of the 99 Names with compact cards.
User interacts with cards to play audio, mark favorites or memorized names, or expand for more detail.
User switches to Flashcard Mode for active recall practice using flip interactions and deck management to focus on difficult names.
User takes quizzes in Quiz Mode with instant feedback and scoring to assess retention and understanding.
User settings managed via React-based interface to customize audio and theme preferences.
User progress such as favorites, memorized sets, and quiz scores are saved in LocalStorage and reflected across sessions.
validation_criteria: Audio playback is clear, correctly matches each name, and can be triggered via card controls.
Filtering and sorting functionality correctly updates the displayed list based on category and status selections.
Flashcards flip smoothly and deck management correctly prioritizes difficult names for study.
Quiz questions are dynamically generated, provide accurate feedback, and update user scores and progress.
User progress including favorites, memorized flags, and scores persist reliably across browser sessions using LocalStorage.
Application UI adheres to the premium dark mode theme with correct typography and responsive layout.
Interactive cards respond with instant and visually appealing feedback without lag.
